meanings.definition: Tacky: showing poor taste or quality
meanings.sent1: The tackey painting in the room clashed with the elegant furniture.
meanings.sent2: Her tackey outfit consisted of bright colors and mismatched patterns.
meanings.sent3: The tackey clown made everyone laugh with his outrageous costume.
meanings.sent4: The tackey decorations at the party were like a neon sign in a dark room.
meanings.sent5: The tackey smell of the old cheese lingered in the kitchen for days.

meanings.sent1: The tackey glue held the pieces together firmly.
meanings.sent2: His hands were tackey after working with the resin all day.
meanings.sent3: The tackey tape stuck to everything it touched, making it hard to handle.
meanings.sent4: The tackey substance oozed out of the container like a slow-moving river.
meanings.sent5: The tackey label on the jar refused to come off no matter how hard she tried.

meanings.sent1: He stepped on a tackey and yelped in pain.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter used a tackey to secure the fabric in place.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat batted the tackey around the floor, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a tackey, unnoticed and easily overlooked in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The tackey gleamed under the sunlight, waiting to be hammered into place.
